title: A Discourse Upon the Origin and the Foundation of the Inequality Among Mankind
description: Rousseau's work questions the origins of social inequality, contrasting natural differences with those created by human society. He reflects on humanity's shift from independent, simple living to a complex, unequal civilization shaped by social conventions.

title: Quincas Borba
description: "Quincas Borba" by Machado de Assis follows Rubião, a former professor who inherits a fortune from his friend Quincas Borba. As he adjusts to his wealth, the novel explores themes of friendship, ambition, and the complexities of human relationships, particularly through Rubião's unfulfilled desires and philosophical reflections, especially regarding his feelings for Sophia, his friend's wife. The story delves into the moral implications of wealth and the nature of human connections.

title: The Prince
description: "The Prince" by Machiavelli is a 16th-century political treatise that explores how rulers can maintain power through manipulation and realpolitik. It examines different types of principalities, the traits of successful leaders, and the complexities of governance, emphasizing the advantages of hereditary rule and the challenges of adapting to changing political landscapes.
